I disagree, Lee Sin got me into Gold Season 2. What bothers me is how safe he is. He is very mobile, has high sustain, and he has Both a Nuke on his ult and an execute on his Q2. That's what got Elise nerfed. Yet Lee still has more of each than Elise. The favoritism is annoying.

Well yeah Lee Sin has much more safety/mobility
Elise has rappel which can only target enemies (so close to Lee Sin Q without needing to hit a skill shot)
But Lee Sin also has Safeguard and his ult to disengage or get out of though spots

Lee Sin isn't an easy champion to play or win with after all if you miss Q you lose a lot of your power
but he is a bit to safe... even if you aren't very good at Lee Sin if you just play it smart and don't suicide for kills you can probably avoid getting caught... or well even if you are caught you might be able to get out with an ult and safeguard and maybe a Q or flash too if necessary...
Actually all of Lee Sin's skills can be used to help him get away

Q gap closing to an enemy target away from whoever is chasing you (a bit conditional but it can be really strong)
W safeguarding to a ward/minion/champion
E a slow to create more distance between you and the enemy
R to push the enemy away and knock up others if they try to chase you

And Lee Sin having 350 base movement speed considering his mobility might be a bit unnecessary

But honestly Lee Sin isn't that strong... unless the Lee Sin player is good... and if that is the case it can feel a bit hopeless and like there is nothing you can do to stop him from jumping all around and destroying your team
